snippet: While Pfc. Bradley Manning faces a life sentence if convicted, his lawyer is demanding answers about his treatment at the Marine base where he was kept.
abstract: Lawyers for Pfc Bradley Manning, who faces life sentence for leaking confidential documents to WikiLeaks, are refocusing attention on his former jailors at Quantico, Va, Marine Corps base; have asked judge to throw out case due to abuses that allegedly included stripping Manning of his clothing and keeping him in isolation.

byline.original: By SCOTT SHANE and CHARLIE SAVAGE
byline.contributor: Scott Shane reported from Fort Meade, and Charlie Savage from Washington.

lead_paragraph: While Pfc. Bradley Manning faces a life sentence if convicted, his lawyer is demanding answers about his treatment at the Marine base where he was kept.

headline.seo: In Private Manning Case, Jailers Become the Accused
headline.main: In WikiLeaks Case, Defense Puts the Jailers on Trial
headline.print_headline: In Leak Case, Defense Puts Jailers on Trial

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
